derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from Latin accumulatio(n-), from the verb accumulare (see accumulate)

entry.def: An accumulation of something is a large number of things which have been collected together or acquired over a period of time.
Accumulation is the collecting together of things over a period of time.

example.ex: ...the accumulation of capital and the distribution of income...
example.tran: 资本的积累和收入的分配

example.ex: The rate of accumulation decreases with time.
example.tran: 积累的速度随着时间变慢。

means.word_mean: 1. an increase by natural growth or addition
2. several things grouped together or considered as a whole
4. (finance) profits that are not paid out as dividends but are added to the capital base of the corporation
